title: By crushing its own people, the Iranian regime paves the way for its own downfall
subhed: In Iran, every uprising and ensuing deadly crackdown has further eroded the regime's legitimacy, with it being seen as increasingly hostile to its own people, clinging to privileges that have become ever more intolerable.

title: EU-Mercosur deal heralds real but far-off gains for the European industrial sector
The Ukrainian-held Donbas, a land of ruins and grief
Trump signs emergency order to protect US-held revenue from Venezuela oil
subhed: The executive order follows a meeting on Friday at the White House where Trump pressed top oil executives to invest in Venezuela, with the chief executive of ExxonMobil describing the country as 'uninvestable' without sweeping reforms. Chevron is currently the only US firm licensed to operate in Venezuela.

title: Bob Weir, founding member of the Grateful Dead, has died at age 78
subhed: A statement released Saturday on Weir's Instagram page announced that the jam band icon 'transitioned peacefully, surrounded by loved ones, after courageously beating cancer.' Weir’s death leaves drummer Bill Kreutzmann as the only surviving original member.

title: When the damage caused by alcohol begins in utero
subhed: Drinking alcoholic beverages during pregnancy can trigger more or less severe neurodevelopmental and growth disorders. Recent studies also show that fathers' alcohol consumption prior to conception may play a harmful role as well.

title: Christophe Vasseur, baker and restaurateur
subhed: The founder of the hugely popular Du Pain et des Idées bakery in central Paris just opened a welcoming eatery. There, he showcases his mastery of oven baking by offering communal cuisine where large 'mosaic pizzas' take center stage.

title: US announces 'large-scale' strikes against IS in Syria

title: Greenland's parties reject American rule after latest Trump threat

title: EU Commission considers enacting the EU-Mercosur trade deal before MEPs ratify it
Metric or imperial? Canada faces the everyday puzzle of weights and measures
Victor Hugo's lesser-known genius: Decoration
'Don't forget you saved my life': Letter to the stranger who gave me their bone marrow
subhed: Hélène Schlesinger was 37 and had a husband, two children, and plenty of plans for the future when she learned, in 2022, that she had leukemia. For months, the young woman fought as she waited for a bone marrow transplant. She lives thanks to an anonymous donor. All she knows is that he is German and that a part of him now lives inside her.

title: 'In Iran, the conditions that enabled the American operation in Venezuela are not present'
subhed: Political analyst Hamzeh Safavi, whose father is an adviser to Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei, discusses the abduction of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro by the US on January 3 in Caracas, and its impact on the Islamic Republic.

title: 'Christopher Columbus embodying Trump and Meloni's supremacist fantasies is no coincidence'
subhed: 'Debated Figures' (1/5). Once praised by French traditionalist Catholics, the 'discoverer of America' is now celebrated by American and Italian leaders, writes historian Romain Bertrand.

title: France's narrow path toward a budget
'Instead of commenting on the unthinkable, Europeans should take action in Greenland'
'If tomorrow, the US decides to seize Greenland, neither Denmark nor the EU has the means to stop it'
